poem:
**Parade Day**

In rain's persistent patter,  
the brass shines,  
clad in yesterday's tales.  
Flags, like stubborn leaves,  
flutter against gray skies.  
No kings,  
only echoes of footfalls,  
march unseen paths.  
In the map of the nation's heart,  
a river of protests—  
silent,  
yet louder than any drum.  
Today, the streets remember.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Millions expected at ‘No Kings’ protests before Trump’s military parade – live updates 3.56pm BST President Donald Trump said on his Truth Social platform that Saturday’s military parade would go ahead come “rain or shine”. Trump wrote: OUR GREAT MILITARY PARADE IS ON, RAIN OR SHINE. REMEMBER, A RAINY DAY PARADE BRINGS GOOD LUCK. I’LL SEE YOU ALL IN D.C. Earlier, after sharing a picture of army personnel with the message ‘happy 250th birthday army”,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
